alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 3:42PM CST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...TWO ROUNDS OF INCLEMENT/WINTRY WEATHER TONIGHT-SUNDAY AND AGAIN MONDAY-TUESDAY... Rainfall will spread northward into the region this evening. This rain is forecast to change to snow from west to east across the area late tonight through the day Sunday. Uncertainties on when precipitation changes to snow, as well as surface temperatures make snowfall ranges anywhere from a trace to 1 inch, to as much as 4 or 5 inches. Light icing is also possible along the transition zone as it tracks east. A larger and stronger system is expected to move into the area Monday through Tuesday, with totals in excess of 6 inches becoming more and more possible. Strong north winds gusting over 40 mph will also bring blowing snow and visibility concerns. Stay tuned to the latest forecasts regarding these two impactful storm system over the coming days.
